member.name: T:EPICCentral.Utilities.Attributes.PasswordRegexAttribute
member.summary: Validate user-entered password with regular expression. The standard RegexExpressionAttribute is not used for two reasons: 1) it requires the specified regex to be a constant; this ones uses the regex defined by the membership provider, and 2) the error message provided includes the actual regex definition which isn't something an average user will know in the slighest manner. Subclassing RegexExpressionAttribute would seem to be the best approach, but that didn't work; we could not get the client-side validation attributes to be placed in the HTML. So this is a separate implementation, although a rather trivial one.

member.name: T:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController
member.summary: Controls all interfaces for logging in to EPIC Central and account management, such as Password Reset, Registration, Logging on and off. This does not control modifying a user account.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController.LogOn
member.summary: The basic LogOn functionality accepts a Username and Password

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController.LogOff
member.summary: The basic LogOff function. Must force the session to be cleared.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController.Register(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registration occurs after the user account is created by an administrator and the e-mail is sent.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController.ChangePassword
member.summary: Change the users password.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController.ChangePassword(EPICCentral.Models.ChangePasswordModel)
member.summary: Post callback for changing the users password.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController.PasswordPolicy
member.summary: This specifies characters are required for a password. Current must contain at least 1 number 1 uppercase 1 lowercase 1 special character. Specified all of the messages for each requirement.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController.ValidateUsername(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if a username is valid and in use. It is normally bad practice to tell the client if a username is in use because it narrows down bruteforcing to a single target account. However, only administrators can create accounts and you must be logged in to use this function so we know everyone who is aware of this function.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController.Reset(EPICCentral.Models.ResetModel)
member.summary: Basic reset password function. Adds account restriction to all user accounts associated with an email address until the user completes the password reset on at least one of their accounts. TODO: A user should be able to cancel the password reset if it was received or started in error.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController.ResetCompletion(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Resets the password and removes account restrictions for an email address.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController.GetUnrestictedOnly(System.Linq.IQueryable{EPICCentralDL.EntityClasses.UserEntity},System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Get the set of accounts in the specified set of accounts that are not restricted and can be reset.
member.param: set of accounts for a particular email address
username entered by user, if any
message to display for user when there's an issue
member.returns: queryable set of accounts with no restrictions

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController.CreateRestriction(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{EPICCentralDL.EntityClasses.UserEntity},System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a restriction on accounts with the specified e-mail address indication that the user is not allowed to log in while their account is being reset.
member.param: A list of user accounts associated with the e-mail address
The e-mail address entered from the Reset page
If the username has also been forgotten or a normal reset where the user knows their username

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController.SendResetEmail(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates the e-mail using the extension method ControllerContext.Render()
member.param: The e-mail address to send the reset email to.
The unique secret key sent only to that e-mail address that verifies it reached the right person and they can reset their account.
First name of the user.
Last name of the user.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController.ErrorCodeToString(System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus)
member.summary: Converts a .Net Membership.Create() status code to a translated error message to display to the client. Typically it is a good idea to send as little information about other user accounts as possibly, such as only displaying "Invalid username or password" for every error. However, in our scenario, administrators are the only ones who create accounts and we know everyone who accesses the registration page.

member.name: T:EPICCentral.Controllers.AccountController.LoggedOffMenuAttribute
member.summary: Used above, overrides the default ControllerMenuAttribute generated automatically for every controller Displays the logged off menu when a user is logged out. No other Menu attributes are used in this controller, if that changes merge the condition below with base.GetSubMenu()

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Utilities.Crypto.CryptoRand.Pass(System.UInt64,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Is the value in the range of 0 to N * max, where N * max is less than int.MaxValue and (N + 1) * max is greater than int.MaxValue?
member.param: potential random value
maximum acceptable value
member.returns: true if the value passes the check, false if not

member.name: T:EPICCentral.REST.Core.ServiceHost
member.summary: A specialized that can accept a maximum message size parameter on construction and then configure the bindings to allow the service to accept messages of that maximum size.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.REST.Core.ServiceHost.#ctor(System.Type,System.Int32,System.Uri[])
member.summary: Construct an instance for the specified Type and base addresses. It will configure the bindings to receive messages up to the specified maximum message size. If the default message size is greater than the size specified, the default will not be changed.
member.param: the Type of the class that implements the service
maximum size of messages that can be received; 0 specifies that the default be used
base URI addresses for the service

member.name: M:EPICCentral.REST.Core.ServiceHost.OnOpening
member.summary: When the ServiceHost instance is opened/initialized, set the maximum message size if necessary.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.REST.Core.ServiceHost.ConfigureEndpoint(System.Uri)
member.summary: Configure any endpoint for the maximum size of message.
member.param: base address for the service
member.returns: true if an endpoint is configured, false if no endpoint is configured

member.name: T:EPICCentral.REST.Core.ServiceHostFactory
member.summary: A specialized for creating instances with binding configured to accept messages larger than the default size of the system.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.REST.Core.ServiceHostFactory.#ctor
member.summary: Construct an instance of the factory to create instances able to recieve messages restricted to the default message size of the system.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.REST.Core.ServiceHostFactory.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Construct an instance of the factory to create instances able to recieve messages of the specified size. If the specified message size is 0, the default message size of the system will be used.
member.param: maximum size (in bytes) for messages received; use 0 to keep the system default size

member.name: M:EPICCentral.REST.Core.ServiceHostFactory.CreateServiceHost(System.Type,System.Uri[])
member.summary: Create a instance implemented by the specified Type for the specified base addresses. The ServiceHost will configure the transport bindings to accept messages restricted to the maximum size specified when the factory was constructed.
member.param: Type of the class that implements the service
base URI addresses that will invoke the service
member.returns: a ServiceHost instance for the service

member.summary: Base class that providers extend.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Providers.PermissionProvider.UserHasPermission(System.String,System.Reflection.MethodBase,System.Object)
member.summary: Tries to find a method that matches entity type and uses the methods access attributes to determine permissions.

member.name: M:EPICCentral.Providers.PermissionProvider.UserHasPermission(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Tries to find a provider with a permission method that matches the entity type and checks permissions based on the permission name passed in.
member.param: The user to check permissions for.
The string descriptor of the permission to check.
The context entity of what the user is trying to access.

member.name: M:MembershipUserExtensions.ChangeUsername(System.Web.Security.MembershipUser,System.String,MembershipUserExtensions.SaveUsername)
member.summary: Change the current user's username and update the current authentication cookie to include the new username. This process isn't as simple as just updating the user's entity record in the database. Since it's the current user, the authentication cookie must be updated with the new username. This is done by signing out the user and then reauthenticating the session with the new username.
member.param: current logged in user's membership
user's new username

a delegate that will be invoked to actually save the new username to the database; if not provided, the username will simply be updated in the current logged-in user's record; this allows the update to be performed within a transaction
member.returns: true if successful, false if the new username is not unique

member.name: T:MembershipUserExtensions.SaveUsername
member.summary: Delegate for saving an updated username to the database. Invoked after validation is complete, but before the current user is signed out and then reauthenticated.
member.param: current user's new username
